question: Dyskeratosis is characteristic feature of ?
exp: Dyskeratosis - Premature or abnormal keratinization Seen in -1. Malignant condition : Squamous cell carcinoma2. Premalignant : Bowen's disease3. Benign conditions :a. Darier's diseaseb. Hailey-hailey disease

question: Defect seen in Hailey Hailey disease?
exp: Hailey-hailey disease / Benign familial pemphigus Occurs due to defect in gene: ATP2C1 gene which codes for: SERCA (Sarco Endoplasmic reticulase Ca2+ ATPase). Therefore, in this disease Ca2+ ATPase is defective. Ca2+ required for attachment of two desmosomes. ATP7A mutation causes Menke's disease. ATP7B mutation - Wilson's disease ATP2A2 mutation - Darier's disease.

question: TRIAD of Poikiloderma includes all except :
exp: Poikiloderma is characterised by triad of Skin atrophy Telengectasia Pigmentary changes Poikiloderma is associated with Mycosis fungoides(Cutaneous T cell lymphoma) Skin hyperophy is the feature of Lichenification.

question: Dyskeratosis is feature of all except:
exp: Dyskeratosis - Abnormality in the process of epidermal cell keratinization. Dyskeratosis occurs in two main contexts Malignant and premalignant epithelial lesions: Squamous cell carcinoma Bowen's disease Paget's disease and Solar keratosis. Benign Acantholytic disorder Darier's disease. In Darier's disease, specific types of dyskeratotic cell include corps ronds ( in lower epidermis) and corp grains (upper epidermis)

question: In which of the following conditions Parakeratosis most frequently occurs?
exp: Parakeratosis - retention of nucleus in stratum corneum It represents a disturbance of keratinization Commonly seen in many different forms of inflammatory dermatosis, and is closely associated either with increased epidermal cell turnover or with inflammatory changes in the epidermis itself. Parakeratosis is seen in; PEA'S2 -Psoriasis -Eczema -Actinic keratosis -Seborrheic dermatitis -Squamous cell carcinoma

question: Lichenification occurs in which layer of skin:
exp: Lichenification is seen in Stratum malpighii (stratum Spinosum along with stratum basale) LICHENIFICATION- Thickening of the epidermis (and to some extent also of the dermis) in response to prolonged rubbing. It is a secondary skin hyperophy ; thick, leathery skin, giving the skin a leathery bark-like appearance. It is a common consequence of atopic dermatitis;eczema and other pruritic disorders. Associated with acanthosis( thickening of stratum spinosum)

question: Irregular acanthosis is seen in :
exp: Acanthosis - increase in number of cells in the Malpighian or prickle cell layer of the epidermis Increased thickness of the epidermis may result from an increased length of rete ridges or may affect the whole epidermis Acanthosis is commonly accompanied by other histological changes - as hypergranulosis, hyperkeratosis and papillomatosis.May be seen in a wide variety of inflammatory and neoplastic disorders. Irregular acanthosis - Lichen planus(saw tooth acanthosis) Regular acanthosis - Chronic eczema , psoriasis

question: Acanthosis involves:-
exp: Acanthosis - Thickening of prickle cell layer or malphigian layer. Increase in number of keratinocytes in the prickle cell layer of the epidermis Pseudoacanthosis - increased thickness of the epidermis due to enlarged keratinocytes Acanthosis, Acantholysis- Stratum spinosumHypergranulosis, Agranulosis- Stratum Granulosum

question: Pautriers microabscess are seen in:-
exp: Pautrier's microabscess are small collections of lymphocytes in epidermis These are malignant atypical lymphocytes seen in cutaneous T cell lymphoma/ Mycosis fungoides (MC cutaneous lymphoma).

question: Spongiosis involves:
exp: Spongiosis :extracellular accumulation of fluid in stratum spinosum. Eg: Acute eczema Ballooning: intracellular accumulation of fluid in stratum spinosum.Eg: Acute eczema Acanthosis :thickening of stratum spinosum. Eg: Chronic eczema

question: Tzank cell is:
exp: Tzanck cells are acantholytic cell or acanthocytes formed due to separation of keratinocytes due to defect in desmosomes. Characterstic on tzank smear Acanthocytes Multinucleate Giant cells Dyskeratotic Keratinocyte Necrotic Keratinocyte Examples Pemphigus -Herpes -Chicken pox -Darier's disease -SJS/TEN
